intro: Fragariopsis paxii, commonly known as the Paxii wood sorrel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellow flowers with five petals. It is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in temperate regions of the Southern Hemisphere. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
